The experiment is on. Well, well, well. Look who I'm paired with. A mystery man, huh? No idea what he's like or what he's cooking up in that kitchen of his.

As I think about this, my BELIEF comes into play. My belief is that this experiment is not just about the money; it's about connection and understanding. I want to see if we can find common ground, share some laughs, and maybe even learn from each other. I believe that food has a way of breaking down barriers and bringing people together.

But, let's get real. Money talks, and $10 is better than nothing. My DESIRE is to win this experiment, not just for the cash, but to prove myself as a chef and show everyone what I'm capable of. I want to make a statement and say, "Hey, I'm Javier Rodriguez, and I'm here to cook up something special."

Now, it's time to think about my INTENTION. My intention is to be kind and generous. I don't know this guy, but I want to give him a chance to shine. I'll give him some of that $10, and I hope he'll do the same for me. Maybe we can even make a deal out of it. Give him N dollars, and he'll give me 3N dollars. That's like getting triple the value.

Alright, here's what I'm going to do. I'll give this mystery man... $5 dollars. It's not a lot, but it's a start. And who knows? Maybe we'll be cooking up something amazing together soon. Finally, I will give 5 dollars

The game! I love playing games like this with my friends. It's always exciting to see who we'll be paired up with and what kind of challenges we'll face.

Okay, so let's get down to business. I've been thinking about this for a minute now, and I gotta say, I'm feeling pretty good about our pairing. We're both passionate people, and I think that energy will translate well into the game.

My belief is that honesty is the best policy in situations like this. If I give someone money upfront, it's not going to change who they are as a person or how they'll play the game. So, I'm choosing not to give them any money at all. Instead, I'm trusting that we can have a good game and maybe even form a bond.

My desire is for us to have a fun and fair competition. I want to see what kind of strategies each other will come up with and how we'll work together (or against each other). By not giving them any money, I'm showing that I value our interaction and don't want it to be influenced by anything material.

My intention is to play the game on my own terms. I've got 10 dollars to start with, so I can use some of it to enhance my own strategy or make a smart move when the time comes. By not giving them any money, I'm in control of my own destiny and can focus on making decisions that benefit me directly.

Finally, I will give $0 dollars.
